item.title: Spotify raises subscription prices
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Spotify is raising prices for users in some international markets after a rough quarterly earnings report.

item.title: Amazon shuts down Wondery podcast studio, cuts 110 jobs
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Despite securing big names in the business, the company is now shifting its strategy in an effort to better compete with rivals like Spotify and YouTube.

item.title: North Korean spies posing as remote workers have infiltrated hundreds of companies, says CrowdStrike
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: North Korean IT workers are increasingly using generative AI to draft resumes and "deepfake" their appearances to make money for North Korea's sanctioned nuclear weapons program.

item.title: OpenMind wants to be the Android operating system of humanoid robots
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: OpenMind is building humanoid robot operating software designed for robots that interact with people and other robots.

item.title: Character.AI is adding a social feed to its app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The social feed lets users share images, videos as well as their chatbots with other users. Users can also share snippets of their chats with characters, post AI-generated images based on their chats with a character, or even have their characters debate topics on a live stream.

item.title: Joby Aviation to buy Blade Air Mobility’s ride-share business
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Joby is buying the Blade brand and the company's passenger business, which includes operations in the United States and Europe, for as much as $125 million.

item.title: Tesla hands $29B comp package to Elon Musk amid ‘AI talent war’
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The plan would be voided if the Delaware Supreme Court overturns the decision to spike Musk's $56B comp plan from 2018. A judge ruled in 2024 that plan was unfairly negotiated.

item.title: Apple might be building its own AI ‘answer engine’
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Apple is reportedly working to create a lightweight competitor to ChatGPT.

item.title: Mastercard denies pressuring game platforms, Valve tells a different story
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Mastercard seemingly denied playing a role in a recent marketplace crackdown on games with adult content, while Valve says the pressure was indirect.

item.title: SAP is acquiring SmartRecruiters
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: SAP has reached an agreement to acquire SmartRecruiters, with SmartRecruiters' software complementing SAP's existing HR tools.

item.title: Inside OpenAI’s quest to make AI do anything for you
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI developed the first AI reasoning model less than a year ago, but the technology has shifted Silicon Valley's focus to agents.

item.title: The uproar over Vogue’s AI-generated ad isn’t just about fashion
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: “Modeling as a profession is already challenging enough without having to compete with now new digital standards of perfection that can be achieved with AI,” Sarah Murray told TechCrunch.

item.title: Tim Cook reportedly tells employees Apple ‘must’ win in AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook held an hourlong all-hands meeting in which he told employees that the company needs to win in AI: "Apple must do this. Apple will do this."

item.title: Lina Khan points to Figma IPO as vindication of M&A scrutiny
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A surprising figure is celebrating Figma’s successful IPO: Lina Khan, former chair of the Federal Trade Commission, who said the offering demonstrates the value of "letting startups grow into independently successful businesses."

item.title: Anthropic cuts off OpenAI’s access to its Claude models
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Anthropic has cut off one of its biggest competitors, revoking OpenAI’s access to its Claude family of AI models.

item.title: What founders should think about if looking to raise a Series C
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: And it starts with a reality check, according to Sapphire Ventures partner Cathy Gao.

item.title: Venture firm CRV raises $750M, downsizing after returning capital to investors
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The 55-year-old VC firm announced its twentieth fund.

item.title: Kleiner Perkins is having a very good week
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: With two IPOs this week alone, Kleiner Perkins partner Mamoon Hamid has reason to celebrate.

item.title: A backlog at the Commerce Department is reportedly stalling Nvidia’s H20 chip licenses
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: News of a backlog at the U.S. federal department comes less than a week after national security experts urged the Trump administration to reverse its decision that allows Nvidia to export H20 chips to China.

item.title: Tesla partly liable in Florida Autopilot trial, jury awards $200M in damages
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The jury verdict is one of the first major legal decisions about driver assistance technology that has gone against Tesla. Both Elon Musk and Tesla have spent years making claims about Autopilot's capabilities.
